body_html: If you use module.is<nn::Conv2d>(), module is still a Module and not a Conv2d. So you still had to use string access to get at the parameters. Wouldn't you be able to use a method directly if you actually casted to nn::Conv2d?
body_text: If you use module.is<nn::Conv2d>(), module is still a Module and not a Conv2d. So you still had to use string access to get at the parameters. Wouldn't you be able to use a method directly if you actually casted to nn::Conv2d?
body: If you use `module.is<nn::Conv2d>()`, `module` is still a `Module` and not a `Conv2d`. So you still had to use string access to get at the parameters. Wouldn't you be able to use a method directly if you actually casted to `nn::Conv2d`?
